item.title: *Subdued Thank You*
item.description: Back in early July we lost a very good friend after a short illness… it was devastating to lose a friend that we loved so much. She was one of my regular customers in terms of card orders. Her husband approached me after her funeral, asking if I would please make him some thank you cards to send out to people who helped out so much during her brief illness and after her death… and I said “of course”.

item.title: *CAS Colours & Sketches #477*
item.description: Patricia is our host for the month of July at CAS Colours & Sketches… she chose this wonderfully right colour palette for our first challenge this month. Being a part of this design team, I have discovered that I am much better at sketch challenges than I am with colour challenges. When I was only playing along, if the colours didn’t speak to me, I didn’t play. If the colours were at all challenging to me, I didn’t play.

item.title: *CAS Colours & Sketches #467*
item.description: This will be my last post with CAS Colours & Sketches until my wrist heals enough to craft again. My surgery on Friday went well and I’m in less pain than I was before surgery. I have no idea when I’ll be able to do things with the right hand again… I’m guessing I’ll have some answers after my surgical follow up on the 2nd. But for today, my card using the current sketch at CAS Colours & Sketches… I wanted to leave my background white but I just couldn’t.

item.title: *Sparkles*
